summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant United States Attorneys from the Southern District of New York and Jill Greenfield, a partner at Fieldfisher law firm, regarding scheduling a videoconference with Greenfield's client to discuss the client's questions and concerns related to the Epstein investigation. The emails discuss logistical challenges due to COVID-19 travel restrictions.

persons.name: Jill Greenfield
persons.context: Attorney representing a client who wishes to speak with the U.S. Attorney's Office about the Epstein investigation. She initiates contact to schedule a discussion.

events.title: Proposed Videoconference
events.description: A videoconference is proposed for 10 a.m. on September 24, 2020, between the U.S. Attorney's Office and Jill Greenfield's client to discuss the Epstein investigation.

locations: Southern District of New York, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
London, England (Fieldfisher office at Riverbank House, 2 Swan Lane, London EC4R 3TT)
keyFacts: A client of attorney Jill Greenfield sought to speak with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding the Epstein investigation.
The communication occurred in September 2020, indicating ongoing investigative activity related to Epstein after his death.
COVID-19 travel restrictions prevented in-person meetings, leading to the scheduling of a videoconference.
The U.S. Attorney's Office mentioned an updated investigation team, though the specific prosecutors' names are redacted.
The correspondence shows coordination between U.S. prosecutors and a UK-based attorney regarding a witness or person of interest.
